name: palaeocene
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
from or referring to the period of time between about 66 and 56 million years ago: He identified and mapped marine Palaeocene sediments in the Casterton region. The crocodile will be part of a new Palaeocene Era display.
More examplesFewer examplesThe Palaeocene Epoch was preceded by the Cretaceous Period.The museum houses a reconstruction of a Palaeocene mammal that lived around 65 million years ago. The singer looks straight from the Palaeocene age with his blue neck and reptilian legs.

Specific periods of time
the Palaeocene
the Palaeocene period (= the period of time between about 66 and 56 million years ago): The fossils come from the Palaeocene. There were two volcanic events in the Palaeocene.
More examplesFewer examplesAt the end of the Cretaceous and beginning of the Palaeocene the climate of the Earth underwent a profound change.During the Palaeocene many modern plant species appeared, such as cacti and palm trees.The artiodactyl was a hoofed mammal that lived some sixty million years ago during the Palaeocene.
